Text: I'm tired.I've been at the hospital for the last 3 months more often than not.I've been on the radio every weeknight explaining developments in #COVID19.We are in a crisis made worse by Trudeau's incompetence, but still, all we talk about is his hair. https://t.co/l6Uc16orAb
We didn't forget about Mike Brown. Snowden. Manning. Wikileaks. Drone war. Should we continue?You expanded the surveillance state just like Trump. The difference: the mainstream media liked you.

Consider following these four guidelines to protect yourself and those around you from #COVID19. 1. Wear a cloth face cover when around others.2. Wash your hands often.3. Practice social distancing.4. Do not touch your eyes, nose and mouth. https://t.co/IKqBWAKrhK

"It's like a double helix, my professional and my personal life" — the head of geriatrics at Mass Gen, who has spent years helping families cope with impending loss, loses her own mother to #Covid19. https://t.co/AX89XKVmJX

New reporting: After Putin gave Trump a pep talk about how strongmen don't hide in their houses with the lights off, he sang an acapella version of George Michael's Father Figure while Trump wept softly and sucked his thumb.

Jackie Csonka-Peeren from @TRSMRyersonU talks with @nowtoronto about the importance of face mask production during #COVID19 and how this is helping some #Toronto small businesses. https://t.co/nT89vVhraT
trump called Governors and Mayors "fools" and "weak" on a conference call.You heard that right: Mr. Inject Bleach, who spent the night in a hidey hole with the lights out, said those words.

1989: Trump took out a full-page ad, arguing for the death penalty for a group of black men (The 'Central Park Five'), effectively putting a bounty on their heads, and plaguing them with a lifetime of death threats. He was sued by the Justice Department for discrimination.
